title: Agent Protocol Definition
description: A schema for defining a single, modular agent protocol.

protocol_id.description: A unique, machine-readable identifier for the protocol (e.g., 'core-directive-001').

description.description: A human-readable summary of the protocol's purpose.

rules.description: An array of formal rules that constitute the protocol.

rule_id.description: A unique identifier for the rule within the protocol.

description.description: A detailed, formal description of the rule to be followed.

enforcement.description: A human-readable description of how the rule is enforced. This is optional if machine-enforceable fields are present.

effect.description: The machine-enforceable effect of the rule. 'deny' means the specified actions are forbidden.

tool_name.description: A list of tool names that this rule applies to for machine enforcement.

associated_tools.description: An optional list of tools that are directly related to or governed by this protocol.

items.description: The name of the tool or script (e.g., 'tooling/fdc_cli.py').
